title: North Darfur displacement worsens as Sudan paramilitary tightens siege
summary: El-Fasher’s population has plummeted by 62% as RSF attacks intensify, marking one of Sudan’s worst humanitarian crises.

title: Trump predicts Gaza ceasefire talks will go ‘very quickly’
summary: US President Donald Trump said he believes negotiations involving Israel and Hamas will go “very quickly”.

title: Greta Thunberg “humiliated” by Israeli forces
summary: Italian journalist Lorenzo D’Agostino says Israel subjected him and Global Flotilla members to “barbaric” treatment

title: Barcelona suffer shock defeat at Sevilla in La Liga
summary: Barcelona's unexpected loss to Sevilla drops the Spanish champions two points behind Real Madrid on La Liga ladder.

title: LIVE: Aid seekers killed in Gaza as Egypt hosts Israel, Hamas officials
summary: Israeli continues to attack Palestinians in Gaza as delegations from Hamas, Israel and mediators convene in Egypt.

title: Governor slams ‘Trump’s invasion’ as troops deployed in Illinois
summary: Texas governor applauds move to deploy 400 National Guard members from his state to Illinois, Oregon and other states.

title: Australia, Papua New Guinea sign mutual defence treaty
summary: Pukpuk treaty commits the two neighbours to greater military cooperation, although the text is yet to be released.

title: More than 350 trekkers escape blizzard-hit Everest, hundreds still stranded
summary: Rescued trekkers reach China's Qudang township while 200 others still face treacherous Everest conditions awaiting help.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,320
summary: Here are the key events from day 1,320 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: Israel strikes Gaza, killing 24 before Egypt talks on Trump ceasefire plan
summary: Israel and Hamas set to hold indirect talks on Monday to discuss a US-led initiative largely accepted by both sides.

title: Parents see tragedy, not fault, in Indonesia school collapse
summary: Rescue teams search for survivors in Indonesia as the boarding school collapse death toll rises to at least 40.

title: Gov Newsom says Trump is sending California National Guard troops to Oregon
summary: The deployment would mark the latest escalation of Donald Trump’s use of US federal intervention in Democrat-led cities.

title: En direct, Plan Trump : les négociations indirectes Israël - Hamas sur le point de débuter en Égypte
summary: Des délégations du Hamas, d'Israël et des États-Unis doivent entamer lundi à Charm el-Cheikh, en Égypte, des négociations indirectes pour obtenir la libération des otages retenus à Gaza et mettre fin à la guerre. Près d'une semaine après avoir présenté son plan de paix, Donald Trump exige un avancement "très rapide". Suivez notre direct.

title: Guerre à Gaza : Quels seront les points discutés lors des pourparlers attendus en Égypte ?
summary: "Les principes généraux seraient déjà acceptés. Ce seront les détails qui seront discutés demain. Mais comme on le sait, les 'détails' n'en sont absolument pas", explique Melina Huet chroniqueuse internationale de France 24. Parmi les points à éclaircir lundi au Caire : le calendrier de libération des otages, la liste des prisonniers palestiniens à libérer, les modalités complètes du redéploiement des troupes israéliennes, les points de passage et les corridors humanitaires ou encore les mécanismes de surveillance du futur cessez-le-feu.

title: Gaza : Donald Trump "veut vraiment être celui qui change les choses"
summary: Pascal Boniface, directeur de l'Institut des relations internationales et stratégiques (IRIS), était l'invité de l'antenne de France 24 ce dimanche 5 octobre.

title: Un journaliste du Monde passe trois heures dans la bande de Gaza
summary: Correspondant du journal Le Monde à Jérusalem, Luc Bronner a pu passer trois heures dans la bande de Gaza sous escorte israélienne. Il était l'invité de l'antenne de France 24 ce dimanche 5 octobre et livre son témoignage.

title: Plan de paix de Donald Trump : des négociations au Caire ce dimanche
summary: Le président américain Donald Trump a prévenu samedi qu'il ne "tolérerait aucun retard" dans l'application de son plan — qui vise à mettre fin à la guerre dans la bande de Gaza et à la libération des otages. Des négociateurs israéliens et du mouvement islamiste palestinien Hamas sont attendus dimanche 5 octobre au Caire pour des discussions indirectes sur le plan du locataire de la Maison Blanche.

title: Plan de paix pour Gaza : la priorité pour Netanyahu reste la libération des otages
summary: Le Premier ministre israélien Benjamin Netanyahu estime les deux objectifs que sont la libération des otages et le démantèlement militaire du Hamas dans la bande de Gaza sont en passe d'être atteints. Selon le chef du gouvernement israélien, c'est bel et bien la pression militaire exercée depuis deux ans contre le Hamas dans la bande de Gaza qui a fait plier le mouvement islamiste et l'a conduit à accepter les conditions posées par Donald Trump. Les précisions de notre correspondant à Jérusalem, Stéphane Amar.

title: Plan Trump : avant des négociations lundi, Washington met Netanyahu et le Hamas sous pression
summary: Des négociateurs israéliens et du Hamas sont attendus dimanche soir au Caire pour des discussions indirectes lundi sur le plan Trump. Celui-ci ambitionne de mettre fin à la guerre à Gaza et de parvenir à la libération des otages. Le président américain et son chef de la diplomatie ont sommé le gouvernement israélien et le Hamas de respecter leurs futurs engagements en cas d'accord. Retrouvez ici le fil de la journée du 5 octobre 2025.

title: La Syrie organise ses premières législatives post-Assad, le processus contesté
summary: La Syrie se dote dimanche de son premier Parlement de l'ère post-Assad dans un processus critiqué pour son manque de démocratie, le tiers des membres étant nommé par le président intérimaire Ahmad al-Charaa.

title: Plan pour Gaza : Israël et le Hamas attendus lundi au Caire pour des négociations indirectes
summary: Benjamin Netanyahu a dit samedi espérer la libération de tous les otages retenus à Gaza "dans les prochains jours", alors que des délégations israélienne et du Hamas doivent se rendre au Caire lundi pour des négociations sous médiation égyptienne. Malgré l’appel de Donald Trump à cesser les bombardements, l’armée israélienne poursuit ses opérations dans l’enclave palestinienne.

title: Hakim Khaldi : "La première urgence, c'est de réunifier le pays"
summary: Après 50 ans de dictature, la Syrie organise ses premières élections législatives libres sur le papier, même si le nouvel homme fort du pays, l'ancien chef des rebelles du groupe Hayat Tahrir al-Cham Ahmed al-Charaa, garde largement la main sur le processus électoral. Dans un discours remarqué à la tribune de l'Assemblée générale de l'ONU la semaine dernière, il a promis de réunifier la Syrie et de juger les personnes responsables d'exactions à l'encontre des minorités. Des règlements de compte de l'ère post-Assad qui ont suscité beaucoup d'interrogations sur les intentions du nouveau pouvoir et sa capacité à ramener la sécurité dans le pays. Hakim Khaldi, humanitaire chez Médecins Sans Frontières et auteur de l'ouvrage "Dans la Syrie post-Assad : Carnets de bord" (éd. L'Harmattan), était l'invité d'"Au cœur de l’info".

title: Plan Trump : encore de nombreuses zones d'ombre
summary: Vendredi, le Hamas s'est dit prêt à des négociations immédiates en vue de la libération des otages israéliens et de la fin de la guerre qui ravage depuis près de deux ans la bande de Gaza, dans le cadre d'un plan proposé par le président américain Donald Trump. Mais de nombreuses zones d'ombres persistent dans ce plan. Analyse de David Delos, chroniqueur international à France 24.

title: Violentes frappes sur la ville de Gaza, Trump appelle Israël à mettre fin aux bombardements
summary: L'armée israélienne a déclaré samedi 4 octobre poursuivre son offensive dans la ville de Gaza et a averti les habitants de ne pas retourner dans la zone, malgré un appel du président américain Donald Trump à mettre fin immédiatement aux bombardements d'Israël. Le point avec Claire Duhamel, correspondante de France 24 à Jérusalem.

title: Le FMI se dit prêt à aider le Sénégal, dont il salue les efforts de transparence
summary: Dakar est confronté à une situation économique préoccupante, avec un déficit budgétaire de 14 % et un encours de dette publique représentant 119 % du PIB.

title: Election présidentielle en Côte d’Ivoire : Charles Blé Goudé se range derrière Simone Gbagbo
summary: Celui qu’on appelait le « général de la rue » ne peut pas se présenter au scrutin du 25 octobre en raison d’une condamnation pénale pour des faits liés à la sanglante crise post-électorale de 2010-2011.

title: Au Maroc, des centaines de jeunes ont battu le pavé pour le neuvième jour consécutif
summary: Depuis le 27 septembre, des manifestants exigent des réformes dans l’éducation et la santé, la fin de la corruption et le départ du chef du gouvernement.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : un mort et plusieurs blessés dans les attaques russes de la nuit
summary: Une personne a notamment été tuée et 11 autres ont été blessées dans l’oblast de Zaporijia, a annoncé son chef de l’administration militaire, lundi matin. Volodymyr Zelensky a dénoncé dimanche l’absence de réaction internationale après les frappes meurtrières russes de la matinée qui avaient fait au moins cinq morts.

title: EN DIRECT, Gaza : des négociations en Egypte pour tenter de mettre fin à la guerre
summary: Donald Trump s’attend à ce que la première phase des pourparlers prévus en Egypte aboutisse rapidement. Le Hamas a, lui, affirmé sa volonté de parvenir à un accord pour mettre fin à la guerre à Gaza et procéder à un échange « immédiat » d’otages et de prisonniers avec Israël.

title: Le plan Trump pour Gaza face à l’équation Benyamin Nétanyahou
summary: Le premier ministre israélien louvoie entre la pression du président américain, décidé à faire aboutir sa proposition, et l’intransigeance de ses alliés d’extrême droite.

title: Du foot à la cocaïne, la chute de Money Dog, rattrapé par la justice française
summary: Joël Martinus, né au Suriname et poursuivi en France dans plusieurs affaires de trafic, conteste ces accusations. Son parcours raconte cette Amazonie où butent les investigations, entre la brousse et le fleuve, l’or et la politique.

title: Entre la Pologne et la Biélorussie, l’exceptionnelle forêt primaire de Bialowieza dégradée par les tensions militaires
summary: La dernière forêt primaire d’Europe de basse altitude, autrefois paisible, se retrouve depuis 2021 au cœur des tensions sécuritaires du flanc est de l’OTAN. Non sans conséquences sur sa biodiversité.

title: La double vie de Jared Kushner, affairiste et émissaire de Donald Trump, son beau-père
summary: Le mari d’Ivanka Trump conduit une carrière de diplomate officieux ainsi que de roi du « deal », jonglant avec les milliards et concentrant ses activités sur le Proche et le Moyen-Orient. Son dernier gros coup, réalisé avec le fonds souverain saoudien : le rachat, pour 55 milliards de dollars, d’Electronic Arts, géant du jeu vidéo.

title: « Le Kremlin stabilise difficilement les finances publiques en faisant supporter le coût de la guerre par l’ensemble de la société russe »
summary: En Russie, le boom de l’économie, lié principalement à l’effort de guerre, appartient désormais au passé, et les contribuables vont être davantage mis à contribution, souligne, dans sa chronique, Stéphane Lauer, éditorialiste au « Monde ».

title: Plan de Trump pour Gaza : derrière les négociations techniques qui s’ouvrent, en Egypte, entre Israël et le Hamas, des enjeux très politiques
summary: Les discussions, qui doivent d’abord concerner les conditions du cessez-le-feu et de libération des otages, pourraient s’étendre au calendrier du retrait israélien et à l’administration de l’enclave.

title: En Argentine, un triple « narcoféminicide » provoque l’indignation
summary: Le meurtre particulièrement violent de deux jeunes femmes et une adolescente, fin septembre, a suscité dans le pays de nombreuses réactions et soulevé des questions liées à la définition du féminicide, mais aussi à la précarité et au narcotrafic.

title: Seven Palestinians killed as Israel continues to bomb Gaza
summary:
Seven Palestinians killed as Israel continues to bomb Gaza

At least seven Palestinians were killed by Israeli forces in several areas of the Gaza Strip since dawn on Monday, Al Jazeera Arabic reported.

The Israeli army, in a statement on Telegram, said it carried out a series of attacks on Gaza City even as Trump called for a halt to the bombing amid ongoing talks.

Footage released by the Israeli army shows what appears to be a large explosion in Gaza, Al Jazeera reported.

title: As a doctor in Gaza, I will never leave my patients
summary:
As a doctor in Gaza, I will never leave my patients

Submitted by Hisham Abu Aoun on Thu, 10/02/2025 - 16:07
Even as Israel starves us and withholds vital medicines, we have a duty to the children who rely on us for protection
Dr Hisham Abu Aoun is pictured in the neonatal intensive care unit at the Patient's Friends Benevolent Society Hospital in Gaza City (Photo courtesy of Medical Aid for Palestinians)
On

Having spent more than 25 years caring for children, I chose paediatrics because children are our future. They deserve the best health services and the utmost care from all of us. 

But today, from my hospital in Gaza City, that future is feeling ever-more distant. 

In Gaza City, we are experiencing one of the worst military assaults we have ever seen. Entire residential high-rises are being razed to the ground by Israeli military air strikes. Constant forced displacement orders mean thousands of civilians must flee their homes, yet again. 

This is catastrophic in every sense of the word. We are exhausted; everyone is beyond their breaking point. I do not even know whether I will still be alive tomorrow.

This suffering is compounded by the deliberate starvation campaign imposed by the Israeli army, coupled with severe shortages of medicines and critical medical equipment that we need to cope with this seemingly never-ending genocide.  

I lead the paediatric and neonatal intensive care units (ICUs) at the Patient’s Friends Benevolent Society Hospital in Gaza City, both of which have been established and supported in partnership with Medical Aid for Palestinians.

I currently have 19 patients, including three children in paediatric intensive care, and 10 newborns in neonatal intensive care and other levels of neonatal care. Nearly all are in critical condition, casualties of Israeli military attacks. They have lost limbs, had shrapnel rip through their organs, or been crushed by falling buildings. 

No safe shelter

On one occasion, an entire family’s home was bombed. The mother, eight months pregnant, was pulled from the rubble. She underwent an emergency cesarean section. The baby was admitted to our ICU, where she stayed for three weeks due to repeated seizures caused by oxygen deprivation to the brain. This is something we see almost daily.

Babies arrive at the hospital malnourished and underweight. Their mothers have no safe shelter, no clean water, no food. They are forced to endure constant bombing, displacement and fear. We see a very high rate of premature births, largely as a result of this stress. 

Follow Middle East Eye's live coverage of the Israel-Palestine war

Israel’s punishing blockade means our hospital lacks incubators for newborns, paediatric ICU beds, ventilators, and even basic drugs and baby formula. We have no central oxygen supply, and rely entirely on a dwindling number of oxygen cylinders. 

Children here have died simply because we do not have the supplies to keep them alive, much as we try. 

This is the most basic right of childhood: the right to receive medical care even under the worst circumstances

As Gaza City is invaded and people are forced to flee their homes, the consequences for hospitals, and for my patients, could be absolutely catastrophic. I fear every day that our hospital will receive a forced displacement order from the Israeli army. 

But evacuating the sick children receiving our care would be almost impossible. Moving them without specialised equipment and meticulous medical procedures would almost certainly mean they will die. 

As doctors and nurses, we will stand firm until the last moment, and will not abandon our patients. We will remain by their side until the very end. 

That is despite the unprecedented killing and complete absence of humanity amid the Gaza genocide. More than 1,700 healthcare workers have been killed since the start of Israel’s war on Gaza - an average of more than two of my colleagues every day. 

Deliberate targeting

Despite us having protection under international law, we are not spared, and are often even deliberately targeted by the Israeli military.

The horrific experience of our colleagues last year at al-Shifa Hospital is a clear example of this. When the Israeli army stormed the hospital, a number of doctors, nurses and patients were executed and buried by bulldozers on the hospital grounds. 

These war crimes shame humanity. Is this to be the fate of myself and my other colleagues, too - simply for doing our job and not abandoning our patients?

In Gaza, families are running from death to more death
Read More »

I am not only a doctor. I am a regular Palestinian living this tragedy, under constant attack. I go through each day with almost no basic means of survival, and with great fear for my family - my wife, children and mother - who I leave behind each time I go to work, knowing I may never see them again.

Around eight children currently at the hospital require medical support and equipment to survive. They must not be left to die. All our children must be protected and cared for. 

This is the most basic right of childhood: the right to receive medical care even under the worst circumstances. I cannot imagine leaving a sick child to face death alone. Doing so would be a crime against humanity and against childhood itself.

We, the Palestinian people, love life. We are human beings just like you. We have futures, children, dreams and aspirations that we want to fulfill. Please, stop this genocide. Enough war. Enough destruction. Help us to live.

The views expressed in this article belong to the author and do not necessarily reflect the editorial policy of Middle East Eye.

Israel's genocide in Gaza

title: Israeli Chief of Staff: No intention of returning to days before 7 October 2023
summary:
Israeli Chief of Staff: No intention of returning to days before 7 October 2023

Chief of Staff of the Israeli army Eyal Zamir on Sunday said that his forces had "no intention" of returning to the days before 7 October 2023, Israeli media have reported. 

Zamir made the comment while on a tour of the Netzarim corridor in the Gaza Strip.

Speaking with Israeli soldiers on site, he said that the "military campaign is far from over".

"We must stay alert and ready on defence, and be prepared to resume combat at any moment," Zamir said. "Two years ago, we experienced the darkest day in our history, and we have no intention of returning to the days before October 7, 2023."

"The IDF is reshaping the reality across the Middle East. Our military does not merely contain threats, but strikes with force and eliminates the enemy on every front."

title: Palestinian aid seekers shot dead by Israeli forces in Gaza
summary:
Palestinian aid seekers shot dead by Israeli forces in Gaza

Israeli forces on Monday killed two Palestinians and wounded several others while waiting for aid in the southern Gaza Strip, Al Jazeera Arabic reported, quoting Nasser Medical Complex. 

Israeli forces also targeted the Al-Nasr and Tal al-Hawa neighbourhoods with air strikes, while shelling Al-Jalaa Street in Gaza City. 

Gaza's Government Media Office said that Israeli forces have killed at least 76,600 Palestinians in Gaza since the beginning of the genocide.

title: Israel bombs neighbourhoods in Gaza
summary:
Israel bombs neighbourhoods in Gaza

Israeli forces on Monday targeted the Al-Nasr and Tal al-Hawa neighbourhoods with air strikes, while shelling Al-Jalaa Street in Gaza City, Al Jazeera Arabic reported. 

Gaza's Government Media Office said that Israeli forces have killed at least 76,600 Palestinians in Gaza since the beginning of the genocide.

In a statement, the media office said that the number of missing persons has reached 9,500, adding that the percentage of "total destruction" caused by the Israeli attacks in the Gaza Strip has reached 90 percent.

The occupation has seized control of more than 80% of Gaza's area through invasion, fire, and displacement, after dropping more than 200,000 tons of explosives, it said.

title: Spanish Gaza flotilla activists report rights violation by Israeli authorities
summary:
Spanish Gaza flotilla activists report rights violation by Israeli authorities

Spanish activists of the Gaza humanitarian aid flotilla on Monday alleged mistreatment and violation of rights by Israeli authorities, news agency Reuters reported. 

"Any time that one of us called a police officer, we risked seven or more fully armed people entering our cell, as they did to mine, pointing weapons at our heads, with dogs ready to attack us, and being dragged on the floor. This happened on a daily basis," the activists said.  

The activists made the allegations after arriving in Madrid. 

Some 10 Tunisian activists received a hero’s welcome as they arrived in Tunis, the report said. 

Earlier, Sweden's Foreign Minister Maria Malmer Stenergard said that allegations regarding the abusive treatment of climate activist Greta Thunberg are "very serious" if confirmed. 

Media reports claimed that Thunberg was mistreated by Israeli authorities, including being forced to pose for a photo with an Israeli flag. 

 
 
 
 
View this post on Instagram
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

A post shared by Middle East Eye (@middleeasteye)

title: Reports of Greta Thunberg's abuse in Israel very serous, Swedish minister says
summary:
Reports of Greta Thunberg's abuse in Israel very serous, Swedish minister says

Sweden's Foreign Minister Maria Malmer Stenergard on Sunday said that allegations regarding the abusive treatment of climate activist Greta Thunberg are "very serious" if confirmed, Anadolu news agency reported. 

"I have taken note of the reports of allegations of abusive treatment. If the reports are true, this is very serious. The Ministry for Foreign Affairs and the embassy are working to bring the Swedish citizens home as soon as possible," Malmer Stenergard said in a statement to Swedish news agency TT.

Media reports claimed that Thunberg was mistreated by Israeli authorities, including being forced to pose for a photo with an Israeli flag. 

Greta Thunberg is among more than 400 activists, parliamentarians, and lawyers detained after Israeli forces intercepted the Gaza-bound aid flotilla earlier this week.

Some of the detainees have since been deported, while proceedings for others are still underway.

title: Media Office: 76,600 Palestinians killed, 90 percent of Gaza totally destroyed
summary:
Media Office: 76,600 Palestinians killed, 90 percent of Gaza totally destroyed 

The Government Media Office in Gaza on Monday said that Israeli forces have killed at least 76,600 Palestinians in Gaza since the beginning of the genocide.

In a statement, the media office said that the number of missing persons has reached 9,500, adding that the percentage of "total destruction" caused by the Israeli attacks in the Gaza Strip has reached 90 percent.

The occupation has seized control of more than 80% of Gaza's area through invasion, fire, and displacement, after dropping more than 200,000 tons of explosives, it said. 

"Israeli occupation forces are continuing their genocide in the Gaza Strip despite calls to halt the bombing for the second consecutive day," the statement said, adding "occupation forces have launched more than 131 airstrikes on areas densely populated with civilians and displaced persons."

title: Israel launched 131 air strikes on Gaza in two days, media office says
summary:
Israel launched 131 air strikes on Gaza in two days, media office says

The Government Media Office in Gaza on Monday said that the Israeli forces are continuing their genocide despite calls to halt the bombing for the second consecutive day.

The statement said that Israeli forces have launched more than 131 air strikes on densely populated areas with civilians and displaced persons.

President Donald Trump on Sunday said talks on implementing a truce for Gaza will take days, while his foreign policy chief Marco Rubio warned that Israel needs to stop bombing for a captive release to happen.

title: Morning update
summary:
Morning update

Good morning Middle East Eye readers,

Here are the latest updates from Israel's war in Gaza:

  • Gaza’s Government Media Office said that the number of Palestinians killed in the enclave has exceeded 76,600 since the beginning of the genocide.

  • The office said the number of missing persons has reached 9,500 and the percentage of "total destruction" has reached 90%.

  • More than 80% of Gaza's area is now under Israel, which has dropped more than 200,000 tons of explosives. 

  • Israeli media have reported that 1,152 soldiers have been killed since 7 October 2023, and more than 40% of those killed were under the age of 21.

  • Israeli forces blew up the home of Palestinian prisoner Ahmed al-Haimouni in the West Bank city of Hebron, who they accuse of financing last year's Jaffa attack.

  • Israeli occupation forces carried out raids in areas of the West Bank, including Tulkarm and the town of Deir Jarir.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • The UK government has promised new legislation to crack down on repeated demonstrations in a new move targeting pro-Palestine protesters.

  • Seven Palestinians were wounded after Israeli forces opened fire on them in the Wadi al-Hummus area, east of Bethlehem in the occupied West Bank.

  • Israel has deported a further 29 activists detained by the navy last week for taking part in a flotilla that sought to deliver aid to blockaded Gaza, the foreign ministry said.

  • President Donald Trump on Sunday said talks on implementing a truce for Gaza will take days, while his foreign policy chief Marco Rubio warned that Israel needs to stop bombing for a captive release to happen.

  • Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that Israeli negotiators would depart for Egypt on Monday for talks aimed at securing the release of captives held in Gaza, after a spokesman had said they would leave Sunday.

  • Doctors Without Borders said that Abed El Hameed Qaradaya, 43, died from shrapnel wounds sustained in an Israeli attack on Thursday, becoming the 15th MSF staff member killed during Israel’s two-year war on Gaza.

  • Adalah, the legal and human rights organisation, says the Israel Prison Service has informed the group’s lawyers of its intention to deport about 170 flotilla activists on Monday.

title: Israel planning to deport around 170 flotilla activists tomorrow, lawyers say
summary:
Israel planning to deport around 170 flotilla activists tomorrow, lawyers say

Adalah, the legal and human rights organisation, says the Israel Prison Service has informed the group’s lawyers of its intention to deport about 170 flotilla activists on Monday.

This follows the deportation of about 170 flotilla activists yesterday and today, most of whom were flown to Istanbul, with smaller groups deported to Italy and Spain.

The group said in a statement that "the participants confirmed to the lawyers that widespread assaults and violence" occurred during their first days of detention, but their current situation is "relatively stable, with continued concern over the health of the hunger strikers and denial of adequate medical care."

The Adalah attorneys were "denied access to all participants" during their visits to the prison today and were only permitted a 30-minute meeting with all 11 Tunisian participants, the group added.

title: Greta Thunberg set to be deported from Israel Monday on flight to Athens
summary:
Some 70 flotilla activists expected to leave for Greece, where they can catch flights to their home countries; one activist bites prison staff member, delaying deportation

title: As negotiators head to Egypt, Trump urges ‘first phase’ of Gaza deal this week
summary:
US president urges all sides to 'MOVE FAST' toward an agreement, as Hamas reportedly prepares to make additional demands, Netanyahu said trying to placate his right-wing allies

title: Iran says it holds US and Israel responsible for illegal attacks on nuclear facilities
summary: Baqaei said the abuse of the IAEA reports by the US and three European countries created a pretext for Israel and the US to exploit the situation.

title: 1,152 Israeli soldiers killed since start of Al-Aqsa Storm Operation
summary: Some 1,152 Israeli soldiers have been killed since October 7, 2023.

title: Ancient ‘living fossil’ tadpole shrimp discovered in central Iran
summary: Environmental officials in the city of Ardestan said that this species of shrimp, which dates back approximately 200 million years, was discovered after recent rainfall.

summary: Iranian ambassador to Iraq met with Ammar al-Hakim.

title: Foreign Ministry issues statement on ceasefire plan in Gaza
summary: The Iranian Ministry of Foreign Affairs issued a statement regarding the ceasefire plan in Gaza.

title: IRGC commander: Iran to respond more rigidly to possible threats by aliens
summary: Commander of the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) Major General Mohammad Pakpour underlined that the Iranian Armed Forces are fully prepared to give resolute and rigid response to the enemies.

title: Iran's Beit Sayah wins gold in World Para-Athletics Championships
summary: The Iranian contingent won 15 medals in the 2025 World Para Athletics Championships held in New Delhi, India.

title: Iranian airline launches direct passenger flights between Mashhad and Lahore
summary: Kish Air will operate the route every Saturday, effectively doubling the number of weekly flights from Iran to Lahore.

title: Qeshm’s eco-lodges empower communities, boost tourism
summary: The 149 guesthouses and eco-lodges on Qeshm Island empower local communities and promote sustainable tourism by providing visitors with an authentic cultural experience that reflects the island’s traditions and natural environment.

summary: The Lebanese resistance movement says Hamas’ consultation and coordination with other groups reflects the Palestinian national unity that must be the basis for any negotiations.

summary: A UNESCO-recognized geopark, encompassing Qeshm Island, champions sustainable tourism efforts supported by residents.

summary: The heads of Iran’s ISC and Russia’s Saint Petersburg Mining University signed an MoU to establish a joint scientometrics center.

title: Iran reacts to Turkey move following snapback activation
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 06 (MNA) – Iran’s Foreign Ministry called Turkey’s recent issuance of an enforcement notice for revoked UN Security Council resolutions unnecessary and legally invalid.

title: French PM Lecornu reportedly resigns
summary: French Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu has resigned, BFM TV reported on Monday citing unidentified government sources.

title: Iran Navy Cmdr. in Russia to attend Caspian Naval summit
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 06 (MNA) – The Commander of Iran’s Navy has arrived in St. Petersburg, Russia, to participate in the meeting of naval commanders from Caspian Sea littoral states.

title: Gunman arrested after shooting rampage in Sydney
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 06 (MNA) – NSW Police say they will charge a 60-year-old man, who is accused of indiscriminately firing shots along a street in Sydney's inner-west, with a string of offences.

title: Major blast hits Syria’s Aleppo
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 06 (MNA) – A powerful explosion rocked the northern Syrian city of Aleppo on Monday near the Ashrafiyeh neighborhood, held by the Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF), according to local sources.

title: Iran has no plans to enter talks with US
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 06 (MNA) – Iran's Foreign Ministry Spokesman says that the three European countries’ approach to the nuclear issue altered the course of future talks, adding that Tehran has no plans to hold talks with the US at the current stage.

title: Israel regime kills 24 Palestinians in 24 hours
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 06 (MNA) – 24 Palestinians were martyred in Israeli attacks across various areas of the Gaza Strip over the past 24 hours.

summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 06 (MNA) – Popular Mobilization Forces in Iraq secured and established multiple checkpoints along routes to the Arar border crossing in al-Anbar province.

title: Patriot systems struggle to intercept Russian missiles
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 06 (MNA) – The US Patriot surface-to-air missile systems have been performing poorly in intercepting Russian ballistic missiles.

title: Between the Vatican and Gaza: Where would Christ stand today?
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 06 (MNA) – Inspired by the Gospel story of feeding the four thousand, an Iranian writer asks: if Christ were alive today, would he stay in the Vatican—or sail with the Freedom Flotilla to Gaza?

title: Iraqi leader urges resolving regional issues via dialogue
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 06 (MNA) – Iraq’s National Wisdom Movement leader emphasized in a meeting with the Iranian ambassador that any regional issues should be solved through dialogue.

title: Iran reacts to the Gaza peace plan
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 06 (MNA) – The Foreign Ministry of Iran released a statement, calling on the UN and the rest of the world to prosecute the Zionist regime’s genocide in Gaza and be wary of its bad-faith history of honoring promises.

title: پشتیبانی وزارت نیرو از پروژه‌های مسکن ملی با تأمین مطمئن آب و برق
